paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The study cohort was comprised of only ESS dogs, but interestingly, dogs from Swedish as well as Norwegian and British populations were examined.
The study cohort was comprised of only ESS dogs, but interestingly, dogs from Swedish as well as Norwegian and British populations were examined.

functional_data.summary: The presence of p.R805L was reported in normal mammary tissues and is suggested to be a germline BRCA2 variation.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in affected dogs.
variants.additional_notes: Further investigation is required to confirm the association of this variant with CMT.
key_quotes: The associated SNPs were intronic or appeared non-functional, so the quest to identify the exact risk variants remains open.
Overall, statistically significant associations were detected for one variant in BRCA2 and two in BRCA1.

tables_processed.table_caption: Reported canine germline coding variants in orthologs of known or candidate BC susceptibility genes

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data is based on the information provided in the main text and tables.
